tags: i've not written meera (or bran really) before and haven't reread their chapters in forever
so i apologize if this is way off-base
also the three-sentence thing really harshed my mellow
question: Older Bran and Meera “...As Robb”
answer:
For this meme.

“Bran, you’ve been on edge for days, won’t you tell me what’s wrong?”

“All my life I’ve wanted to be like Robb, but now I’m where he would be–where he should be–and I haven’t the faintest idea what he’d do.”

“Then don’t be Robb,” says Meera, “just be you.”

reblog.comment:

“Then don’t be Robb,” says Meera, “just be you.”

trail.content_raw:
For this meme.

tags: im really happy with sansas outfit in this
summary: a lifetime ago  Will I ever get tired of drawing happy starklings in the snow? NO!   I wanted to add Jon, Robb and Theon as...
caption:
a lifetime ago

Will I ever get tired of drawing happy starklings in the snow? NO! 

I wanted to add Jon, Robb and Theon as well, but didn’t like the way they turned out, so just imagine them trying to act adult someplace else. And I actually like it better this way, because I feel like the dynamic between Sansa Arya and Bran is often overlooked.

reblog.comment:
a lifetime ago

Will I ever get tired of drawing happy starklings in the snow? NO! 

I wanted to add Jon, Robb and Theon as well, but didn’t like the way they turned out, so just imagine them trying to act adult someplace else. And I actually like it better this way, because I feel like the dynamic between Sansa Arya and Bran is often overlooked.

trail.content_raw:
a lifetime ago

Will I ever get tired of drawing happy starklings in the snow? NO! 

I wanted to add Jon, Robb and Theon as well, but didn’t like the way they turned out, so just imagine them trying to act adult someplace else. And I actually like it better this way, because I feel like the dynamic between Sansa Arya and Bran is often overlooked.
trail.content:
a lifetime ago

Will I ever get tired of drawing happy starklings in the snow? NO! 

I wanted to add Jon, Robb and Theon as well, but didn’t like the way they turned out, so just imagine them trying to act adult someplace else. And I actually like it better this way, because I feel like the dynamic between Sansa Arya and Bran is often overlooked.

blog.name: princessmissandei
blog.title: Night Wolf
blog.description: Marie | Slytherin | Writer About and Before You Follow Multi-fandom blog with an emphasis on ASOIAF and various period dramas. Very fond of canon Starks, Targaryens, Durrandons and Baratheons. Reylos do not engage.

summary: It’s so weird that D&D gave Bran more authority and arguably more experience in ruling than GRRM did in the books. Bran...
body: It’s so weird that D&D gave Bran more authority and arguably more experience in ruling than GRRM did in the books. Bran definitely gets in-depth schooling on the ins and outs of governing the North as well as in Northern politics in the novels, but it’s made clear that Luwin and Rodrick are in charge. He’s primarily there to learn from them and to be the visible Stark in Winterfell. The show has Bran actually making decisions and overruling Luwin. I wonder if that means that once magic becomes dormant again at the end of the series that Bran will fall back into the political and administrative side of his arc as King in the North and Lord of Winterfell. I’m already pretty sure that will happen with his novel endgame, but I’m a lot less confident in his show endgame, all things considered.

reblog.comment: It’s so weird that D&D gave Bran more authority and arguably more experience in ruling than GRRM did in the books. Bran definitely gets in-depth schooling on the ins and outs of governing the North as well as in Northern politics in the novels, but it’s made clear that Luwin and Rodrick are in charge. He’s primarily there to learn from them and to be the visible Stark in Winterfell. The show has Bran actually making decisions and overruling Luwin. I wonder if that means that once magic becomes dormant again at the end of the series that Bran will fall back into the political and administrative side of his arc as King in the North and Lord of Winterfell. I’m already pretty sure that will happen with his novel endgame, but I’m a lot less confident in his show endgame, all things considered.

trail.content_raw: It’s so weird that D&D gave Bran more authority and arguably more experience in ruling than GRRM did in the books. Bran definitely gets in-depth schooling on the ins and outs of governing the North as well as in Northern politics in the novels, but it’s made clear that Luwin and Rodrick are in charge. He’s primarily there to learn from them and to be the visible Stark in Winterfell. The show has Bran actually making decisions and overruling Luwin. I wonder if that means that once magic becomes dormant again at the end of the series that Bran will fall back into the political and administrative side of his arc as King in the North and Lord of Winterfell. I’m already pretty sure that will happen with his novel endgame, but I’m a lot less confident in his show endgame, all things considered.
trail.content: It’s so weird that D&D gave Bran more authority and arguably more experience in ruling than GRRM did in the books. Bran definitely gets in-depth schooling on the ins and outs of governing the North as well as in Northern politics in the novels, but it’s made clear that Luwin and Rodrick are in charge. He’s primarily there to learn from them and to be the visible Stark in Winterfell. The show has Bran actually making decisions and overruling Luwin. I wonder if that means that once magic becomes dormant again at the end of the series that Bran will fall back into the political and administrative side of his arc as King in the North and Lord of Winterfell. I’m already pretty sure that will happen with his novel endgame, but I’m a lot less confident in his show endgame, all things considered.

summary: Better Names for Bran than “three eyed raven”
title: Better Names for Bran than “three eyed raven”
body:
• The King of the North
  • Prince of Winterfell
  • Bran the Builder  (can we fix it? Kind of sort of!)
  • Greenseer
  • Warg
  • Bran the explorer
  • Little Brother 

(follow up to this Arya post)
